channel.title: Asides on Deuts Log
channel.description: Recent content in Asides on Deuts Log

item.title: DumbWareio - DumbDrop: dumb file dropper
item.description:
DumbWareio - DumbDrop: dumb file dropper

A stupid simple file upload application that provides a clean, modern interface for dragging and dropping files. Built with Node.js and vanilla JavaScript.
This could be useful for our Python app, to process CSV/Excel files and send out the output probably via email. I just wish there was a way to change the name DumbDrop right in the center.
item.content:encoded:
DumbWareio - DumbDrop: dumb file dropper

A stupid simple file upload application that provides a clean, modern interface for dragging and dropping files. Built with Node.js and vanilla JavaScript.
This could be useful for our Python app, to process CSV/Excel files and send out the output probably via email. I just wish there was a way to change the name DumbDrop right in the center.

item.title: TinyAuth
item.description:
TinyAuth

The simplest way to protect your apps with a login screen. - steveiliop56/tinyauth
Another authentik and authelia alternative. Hopefully it lives up to its name - - tiny!
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Pocket ID
item.description:
Pocket ID

Pocket ID is a simple OIDC provider that allows users to authenticate with their passkeys to your services.
Authentik and authelia alternative.
item.content:encoded:
Pocket ID

Pocket ID is a simple OIDC provider that allows users to authenticate with their passkeys to your services.
Authentik and authelia alternative.

item.title: DumbWare.io - Stupid Simple Software
item.description:
DumbWare.io - Stupid Simple Software

We make sophisticated problems stupid simple. Our software is like a michelin star restaurant serving chicken nuggets - sophisticatedly Simple.
Stupidly simple selfhosted apps we can explore and deploy anytime.

item.title: SQLook - SQLite Database Viewer and Generator
item.description:
SQLook - SQLite Database Viewer and Generator

SQLook - A free online SQLite database manager with visual query builder. Create, view, and query SQLite databases directly in your browser. Features include visual table generation, sample data population, query assistance, and database visualization.
SQLook is a powerful web-based SQLite database manager that runs entirely in your browser. No installation or server required - just open your SQLite databases and start working with them immediately.
item.content:encoded:
SQLook - SQLite Database Viewer and Generator

SQLook - A free online SQLite database manager with visual query builder. Create, view, and query SQLite databases directly in your browser. Features include visual table generation, sample data population, query assistance, and database visualization.
SQLook is a powerful web-based SQLite database manager that runs entirely in your browser. No installation or server required - just open your SQLite databases and start working with them immediately.

item.title: MicroPie
item.description:
MicroPie

MicroPie is a lightweight Python web framework that makes building web applications simple and efficient. It includes features such as routing, session management, WSGI support, and Jinja2 template rendering.
Not a single idea how this works yet, as I’m still in the journey of learning all about Python, but leaving it here for future reference.
item.content:encoded:
MicroPie

MicroPie is a lightweight Python web framework that makes building web applications simple and efficient. It includes features such as routing, session management, WSGI support, and Jinja2 template rendering.
Not a single idea how this works yet, as I’m still in the journey of learning all about Python, but leaving it here for future reference.

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JJJK3VB2V6QS80SMTK61PKCK
item.description: An effective comparison of the free versions of #RememberTheMilk and #Todoist, examining essential features such as recurring tasks, task limits, smart lists, and integrations to assist users in selecting the most suitable productivity tool. #RTM deuts.org/∞
